result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waives speedy trial.   Court notes 3 files are scheduled with Branch II and one file is with Branch IV.  Court schedules all matters with Branch III.  DE needs to update address before leaving building.  Adjourned at 3:11 PM. bph

Court notes warrant on 22CF343, per the minutes was quashed on 8/11. Order warrant quashed in that matter. TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF343 (INIT) & 22CF196 (STC) & 22CM158 (RW):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for purposes of today only   DF:  Taylor Richard Kemmis appeared from jail via video. Status conference on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least ONE time per week, by MOUTH SWAB. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

- I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- Defendant to comply with the child protection file.

- Defendant to provide baseline before being released.

01:15 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson and Kaitlin Dippolito, DF: Taylor Richard Kemmis appeared from jail. DE does not qualify for Public Defender, DE plans to hire his own atty.  DE can appear by zoom for next hearing if he doesn't have an atty.
